Waldomiro wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> I have an unit of code which show a message when any error happens.
> 
> Then the user needs to click ok to make the message disapears.
> 
> I'd like to automatize the click, so the user doesn't need to be there 
> when JUnit is testing my application.
> 
> Is there anyway to do that ?

If you have access to the dialog object then perhaps there is a click() 
method you can invoke on it. (I know that JOptionPane in Swing makes 
this possible.)

Even better: it looks like you have a logical action (dismiss a dialog) 
that you'd like to perform without performing the corresponding physical 
action (clicking a mouse). You could certainly refactor your code to 
make this possible. If you like, please post the method that displays 
the message box and I'll write about how I would refactor your code to 
make this happen.

Thanks.
